body.p:
Brooksville Sept 10th 1861
Hon T F Marshall & F L Cleveland
Dear Sirs

Accompanying this you will find the Petition of L O Murray, with numerous signers, also affidavit &c -- please present it to the Governor, and if consistant with your feelings, use your influence in getting the fine remitted, you will call his attendion to the statement of J N Furber in the petition, I think it is a case in which his clemency ought to be exercised.

Please attend to this and oblige your
humble servent
C. H. Lee
